author: Staff Reporter
text:
Four persons, including three women, were sentenced to life imprisonment for murdering a farmer in 2014.

According to prosecution C. Thambusamy (55) of Pachamalai in Thammampatti police station limit was married to Chinnathai (42) and has a daughter Mallika. Mallika was married to Chinnakulandai and has son Kumar.

Thambusamy again married Chinnaponnu (45) and was living with her. Trouble erupted between Thambusamy and his first wife Chinnathai over enjoying the land benefits.

On October 8, while Thambusamy was walking near the land, Kumar waylaid him. While Chinnathai, Mallika and Chinnakulandai held him, Kumar hacked Thambusamy to death. Based on a complaint from Chinnaponnu, Thammampatti police registered a case under Section 302 (murder) and 506 (ii) (criminal intimidation) of the IPC.

Third Additional District Judge M. Ravindran also imposed a fine of Rs. 1,000 for the four . Later, Kumar was lodged at Coimbatore Central Prison while the three women were lodged at Vellore Central Prison.
title: Four get life term for murder
